definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
powerful individual, family or group/clique/(loanword) valve

sentences.english: The powerful family hereditary scholar class is in a landlord class's privileged stratum.
sentences.chinese: 门阀士族是地主阶级中的一个特权阶层。

sentences.english: The various expressions of this kind of marriage spoke of the decline of family power and its influence.
sentences.chinese: 南朝国婚士族种种表现反映了门阀士族的相对衰落。

sentences.english: The powerful family hereditary scholar class has the privilege and is maintaining with the commoners the strict boundary.
sentences.chinese: 门阀士族拥有特权并与庶族保持着严格界限。

sentences.english: This period is a historical period when the family of power and influence and the landlords dominated.
sentences.chinese: 魏晋南北朝是门阀地主占主导地位的历史时期。

definition: land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
